The CCP needs to stop obstructing investigators, destroying evidence, and telling ridiculous lies.
The United States & the world must demand a full, impartial investigation into COVID-19 origins, with a special focus on the Wuhan labs.

The lab-leak hypothesis was always reasonable, but reporters & activists in white lab coats nonetheless spent the better part of a year denouncing it as a ‚Äúconspiracy theory.‚Äù They were wrong.
 
But that‚Äôs not what‚Äôs most important now. What‚Äôs important is truth & accountability.

Evidence of a lab leak has been building for months:
 
‚ÄîLax safety conditions at Wuhan Institute of Virology
‚ÄîSimilarities between research at the lab and features of the virus
‚ÄîPatents for bat cages and other live-animal research tools filed by WIV

https://t.co/gLbpMPrvWX

Three Wuhan lab researchers went to the hospital with COVID symptoms in November 2019‚Äîa month before the first confirmed case of the disease.
 
It‚Äôs time for the Chinese Communist Party to come clean about what happened at that lab.

https://t.co/7XZrLRCBFH

Isn‚Äôt it strange that this once-in-a-century bat coronavirus pandemic just happened to emerge within a few miles of China‚Äôs biggest laboratory researching bat coronaviruses? 

Shouldn‚Äôt we at least look at that lab? 
https://t.co/A1q9Ulxl4t

I submitted these questions and many others to Kristen Clarke ahead of the committee vote tomorrow to advance her nomination. She has yet to respond.

Senate Democrats are hell-bent on forcing Clarke‚Äôs nomination so she can use the power of the government to advance far-left policies like Critical Race Theory. The Senate should not consent to Clarke‚Äôs nomination until we receive truthful and complete answers to these questions.

Clarke is nominated to be the head of the Department of Justice‚Äôs Civil Rights Division. But how can she represent the United States in court when she‚Äôs accused more than 200 current federal judges of being ‚Äúwhite male extremists‚Äù?

Clarke needs to answer for her incendiary social media presence. Her account is now locked, but last year she called @lisamurkowski ‚Äúshameful‚Äù and accused @Sen_JoeManchin of ‚Äúhollow words‚Äù because he celebrated Martin Luther King but disagreed with one of her political positions.
